sense.name: a dramatic composition, e.g., for a play
sense.examples: The actor threw his script down in disgust. The film director is working from a revised copy of the shooting script. The screenwriter has optioned a spec script to a major studio. The candidate felt his election team were not all working from the same script. (metaphoric extension)

sense.name: style of personal handwriting
sense.examples: The scrawling large script of the note looked like John's handwriting. The children practiced their script in penmanship class. The crabbed, small script of her notes is almost illegible.

sense.name: a style or type of orthography, e.g., Helvetica
sense.examples: The book was published in a beautiful Russian Cyrillic script. The word-processing program provides dozens of scripts to choose from. Screenplays are required to be formatted using Courier 12-point script.

sense.name: a short sequenced computer program
sense.examples: Mary wrote a Perl script to format the text files into database records. The book provides many useful examples of Unix shell scripts.

sense.name: rote, stereotypical social behavior
sense.examples: The princess was expected to follow the script of being the wife of royalty. Her book on discourse analysis looks at a variety of conversational scripts that occur between customers and clerks in department stores.

sense.name: a doctor's prescription
sense.examples: Dr. Jones wrote Mary a script for an anti-depressant. The scripts are entered via computer and transmitted electronically to the pharmacy.
